thread.title: Russell Crowe sells Darlinghurst warehouse for $17 million | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Russell Crowe sells Darlinghurst warehouse for $17 million | Daily Mail Online

author: Josh Hanrahan
title: Russell Crowe sells Darlinghurst warehouse for $17 million | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 132 shares It's believed that two parties, including McGrath real estate agent Will Manning, were in the running for the property before it sold on Monday. The sale comes after the Gladiator star rejected a $25 million offer for his enormous apartment on Sydney Harbour in recent weeks. Purchase: Crowe bought the warehouse, best known for being home to his Riley Street Gym, in 2003 for $5.05 million Spacious: The Hollywood star was recently offered $25 million for this Finger Wharf apartment that overlooks the water, but instead chose to part ways with his enormours warehouse That apartment, located in Sydney's upmarket suburb of Woolloomooloo, takes up a whole floor, is 1000 square metres and has seven car spaces. Having initially paid $14.35m for the complex in 2003, Crowe was hoping to nearly double his money, asking for up to $30 million last year. The Australian actor has now taken the property off the market altogether. Sold: The warehouse also houses a small headquarters belonging to designer Blainey North Popular: It's believed that two parties, including McGrath real estate agent Will Manning, were in the running for the property before it sold on Monday Lavish: Located in the exclusive Sydney suburb of Woolloomooloo, Crowe's apartment takes up a whole floor, is 1000 square metres and has seven car spaces A huge player in the Sydney property market, Crowe also recently doubled his money on a less luxurious unit block located in the eastern suburb of Kingsford. He made a cool $3.2m profit on the apartment building he originally paid $1.45m for in 2001, according to The Daily Telegraph. The film star bought the property 15 years ago when he was part of infamous rock group 30 Odd Foot Of Grunts. He had reportedly allowed his band mates to live rent-free in the three-storey, four-unit, building for an extended period of time. Tidy profit! The 52-year-old also recently doubled his money on his less luxurious Kingsford unit block, which is located in the eastern suburbs of Sydney That's generous! Russ had reportedly allowed his 30 Odd Foot Of Grunts bandmates to live rent-free in the three-storey, four-unit building for an extended period of time Selling off assets: The Gladiator actor is understood to be close to closing his divorce settlement with his wife of nine years, Australian singer Danielle Spencer The block went up for sale at the end of last year, when Russell is understood to have told his friends who lived there it would be used 'as part of a divorce settlement'. The Gladiator actor and Australian singer Danielle Spencer were married in 2003 and separated in October, 2012. They share two young sons, Charles, 13 and Tennyson, 10. Russell has an extensive property portfolio in Australia, including 400 hectares of land around his Nana Glen Ranch, near Coffs Harbour. The Daily Telegraph reports that the Oscar winner may well be 'one of NSW's largest private land owners'. Land baron! Russell has an extensive property portfolio in Australia and the Oscar winner may well be 'one of NSW's largest private land owners' Read more: Share or comment on this article 132
